verses.verse: A Psalm <WH4210> of Asaph <WH623>. Truly God <WH430> is good <WH2896> to Israel <WH3478>, even to such as are of a clean <WH1249> heart <WH3824>. of: or, for Truly: or, Yet of: Heb. clean of heart
But as for me, my feet <WH7272> were almost <WH4592> gone <WH5186> <WH5186>; my steps <WH838> had well nigh <WH369> slipped <WH8210>.
For I was envious <WH7065> at the foolish <WH1984>, when I saw <WH7200> the prosperity <WH7965> of the wicked <WH7563>.
For there are no bands <WH2784> in their death <WH4194>: but their strength <WH193> is firm <WH1277>. firm: Heb. fat
They are not in trouble <WH5999> as other men <WH582>; neither are they plagued <WH5060> like <WH5973> other men <WH120>. in: Heb. in the trouble of other men like: Heb. with
Therefore pride <WH1346> compasseth them about as a chain <WH6059>; violence <WH2555> covereth <WH5848> them as a garment <WH7897>.
Their eyes <WH5869> stand out <WH3318> with fatness <WH2459>: they have more <WH5674> than heart <WH3824> could wish <WH4906>. have: Heb. pass the thoughts of the heart
They are corrupt <WH4167>, and speak <WH1696> wickedly <WH7451> concerning oppression <WH6233>: they speak <WH1696> loftily <WH4791>.
They set <WH8371> their mouth <WH6310> against the heavens <WH8064>, and their tongue <WH3956> walketh <WH1980> through the earth <WH776>.
Therefore his people <WH5971> return <WH7725> <WH7725> hither <WH1988>: and waters <WH4325> of a full <WH4392> cup are wrung out <WH4680> to them.
And they say <WH559>, How doth God <WH410> know <WH3045>? and is there <WH3426> knowledge <WH1844> in the most High <WH5945>?
Behold, these are the ungodly <WH7563>, who prosper <WH7961> in the world <WH5769>; they increase <WH7685> in riches <WH2428>.
Verily I have cleansed <WH2135> my heart <WH3824> in vain <WH7385>, and washed <WH7364> my hands <WH3709> in innocency <WH5356>.
For all the day <WH3117> long have I been plagued <WH5060>, and chastened <WH8433> every morning <WH1242>. chastened: Heb. my chastisement was
If I say <WH559>, I will speak <WH5608> thus <WH3644>; behold, I should offend <WH898> against the generation <WH1755> of thy children <WH1121>.
When I thought <WH2803> to know <WH3045> this, it was too painful <WH5999> for me <WH5869>; too: Heb. labour in mine eyes
Until I went <WH935> into the sanctuary <WH4720> of God <WH410>; then understood <WH995> I their end <WH319>.
Surely thou didst set <WH7896> them in slippery places <WH2513>: thou castedst them down <WH5307> into destruction <WH4876>.
How are they brought into desolation <WH8047>, as in a moment <WH7281>! they are utterly <WH5486> consumed <WH8552> with terrors <WH1091>.
As a dream <WH2472> when one awaketh <WH6974>; so, O Lord <WH136>, when thou awakest <WH5782>, thou shalt despise <WH959> their image <WH6754>.
Thus my heart <WH3824> was grieved <WH2556>, and I was pricked <WH8150> in my reins <WH3629>.
So foolish <WH1198> was I, and ignorant <WH3045>: I was as a beast <WH929> before thee. ignorant: Heb. I knew not before Heb. with
Nevertheless I am continually <WH8548> with thee: thou hast holden <WH270> me by my right <WH3225> hand <WH3027>.
Thou shalt guide <WH5148> me with thy counsel <WH6098>, and afterward <WH310> receive <WH3947> me to glory <WH3519>.
Whom have I in heaven <WH8064> but thee? and there is none upon earth <WH776> that I desire <WH2654> beside thee.
My flesh <WH7607> and my heart <WH3824> faileth <WH3615>: but God <WH430> is the strength <WH6697> of my heart <WH3824>, and my portion <WH2506> for ever <WH5769>. strength: Heb. rock
For, lo, they that are far <WH7369> from thee shall perish <WH6>: thou hast destroyed <WH6789> all them that go a whoring <WH2181> from thee.

But <WH589> it is good <WH2896> for me to draw near <WH7132> to God <WH430>: I have put <WH7896> my trust <WH4268> in the Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069>, that I may declare <WH5608> all thy works <WH4399>.
